articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: ACLU sues Trump administration for denying asylum to migrants
articles.description: ACLU Attorney Lee Gelernt says President Trump is acting “far outside his authority” and asylum must be available for everyone. General Barry McCaffrey, retired four star general, former national security council member, and NBC News Military Analyst, and Mic…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: One-on-One with Charlamagne Tha God
articles.description: Rev. Al Sharpton talks with radio host Charlamagne Tha God about the outcome of the midterm elections, battling trauma, and his new book titled, “Shook One.”

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: From Midterms to 2020
articles.description: Rev. Al Sharpton is joined by Doris Kearns Goodwin, and Charlie Cook to discuss the outcome of the midterm elections, how to bind the country together and what we may be able to expect for 2020.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Aftermath of Midterm Election: Florida
articles.description: Rev. Al Sharpton is joined by Mara Gay, Christina Greer, and  Michael Steel to discuss the aftermath of the midterm elections, and Florida’s Governor debacle.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: FL attorney: No ‘credible evidence’ of voter fraud in tight races
articles.description: Florida State Attorney for Palm Beach County Dave Aronberg says the rhetoric from President Donald Trump, Governor Rick Scott and others claiming voter fraud or a mass conspiracy needs to be toned down. MSNBC’s Frances Rivera also talks about the tight race i…

articles.title: PoliticsNation 11/10/18
articles.description: PoliticsNation is hosted by Al Sharpton, one of America's most renowned civil rights leader.
articles.content: PoliticsNation with Al Sharpton 11/10/18 PoliticsNation is hosted by Al Sharpton, one of America's most renowned civil rights leader. descriptionLimit">... more Duration: {{video.duration.momentjs}} Up next in: Latest MSNBC videos

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fmr. prosecutor: Choice of acting attorney general is ‘illegal’
articles.description: President Donald Trump has tapped Matthew Whitaker to take the helm of the Justice Department until Jeff Sessions’ permanent successor can be confirmed by the Senate. However, some legal experts argue the move is unconstitutional. MSNBC’s Frances Rivera discu…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Teresa Tomlinson: Lucy McBath turned personal tragedy into mission to serve
articles.description: Democrat and gun control advocate Lucy McBath—mother of fatal shooting victim Jordan Davis—won her Georgia midterms race for Congress in a traditionally Republican district. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gillum won’t concede, ‘unapologetic’ call to count votes
articles.description: Florida Democratic Governor Candidate Andrew Gillum held a news conference to rescind his election night concession speech and asked for every vote to be counted. Gillum is in a neck-and-neck race with Republican Ron DeSantis. MSNBC’s Frances Rivera discusses…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump’s statements to black women journalists called ‘particularly insidious’
articles.description: Donald Trump lashed out at three black women journalists in the eyes of many within three days. Democratic strategist Tara Dowdell joins Joy Reid to discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Karine Jean-Pierre: Because Democrats have flipped states we have different paths to 270 in 2020
articles.description: To understand exactly how big the Blue Wave was on Tuesday, you have to know exactly what the Democrats were up against nationwide. Joy Reid and her panel break it down for you.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Elliot Williams: It's hard to find a serious attorney who will take attorney general job
articles.description: Acting U.S. Attorney General Matthew Whitaker was linked to a company currently under FBI investigation, a branch of the government he now oversees, making him the latest controversial Donald Trump pick. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Gillum makes ‘Unapologetic call’ to count every vote
articles.description: Democratic Florida gubernatorial candidate Andrew Gillum holds a press conference as he awaits a recount in the tight Governor race. Gillum, the current mayor of Tallahassee says, “In America, we count every vote regardless of what the outcome may be.”

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Teresa Tomlinson: There have been broadscale questions of voter suppression in Georgia
articles.description: The Georgia midterm election for governor is still undecided, as votes continue to come in, and Democratic candidate Stacey Abrams has not conceded to Republican Jack Kemp, who leads by a slim margin. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fernand Amandi: Florida, nation’s most important political state, can’t seem to get votes counted
articles.description: The Florida midterm election for governor is not over, with Democrat Andrew Gillum and Republican Ron DeSantis still squaring off do to a slim margin between them. The close race between Republican Rick Scott and Democrat Bill Nelson is also waiting to be cal…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Florida's Secretary of State orders recount for Senate and Governor races
articles.description: Florida Secretary of State has ordered a recount for the top three races in the state, Senate, Governor, and Agricultural Commissioner. Millions of votes will need to be recounted with the deadline on Thursday. NBC’s Ron Allen reports.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Protests erupt in Broward County after officials trigger recount
articles.description: Following the decision to trigger a machine recount around several tight midterm races in Florida, protestors supporting both Republican and Democratic candidates gathered outside the Broward County election offices.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Broward County to undergo machine recount in Florida midterm races
articles.description: Election officials in Broward County announced that multiple tight races in Florida, including elections for senator and governor, will be reviewed in a series of recounts.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Will Whitaker last as the new Attorney General in the Trump Administration?
articles.description: Former Federal Prosecutor Glenn Kirschner gives MSNBC's David Gura his professional opinion on whether Whitaker has a chance in the Trump administration.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump's Acting Attorney General is facing major scrutiny
articles.description: When it comes to the Russia probe, Trump & newly installed Acting AG Whitaker, sound very similar. MSNBC’s David Gura talks to Mike Pesca of “The Gist” on Slate.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Alyona Minkovski: Trump administration 'has been planning' Whitaker appointment
articles.description: Real Vision Senior Reporter Alyona Minkovski joins MSNBC's David Gura to discuss the appointment of Matthew Whitaker to attorney general and why the Trump administration has been planning to replace former Attorney General Jeff Sessions since his recusal from…

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: This Week in God, 11.10.18
articles.description: Trump declared this week, "I am a great moral leader." Two days later, we were reminded of his role in making legally dubious hush-money payments to a porn star
articles.content: First up from the God Machine this week is a new argument from Donald Trump about how – and whether – he should be seen not only as a political leader, but a moral one, too. Traditionally, the president’s allies have defended his moral failings by questioning… [+1940 chars]

articles.title: Florida again the scene of a post-election ballot-counting fight

articles.title: Lawyers in pitched battle over thorough counting of Florida votes
articles.description: Leonard Samuels, attorney for the Florida Democrat Party, talks with Rachel Maddow about the Democrats' legal battle in Broward County, Florida to have all of the votes cast in Florida's election counted.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Michelle Obama on Trump's presidency: Where is the bottom?
articles.description: In her upcoming memoir, Michelle Obama criticizes Trump for birtherism and much more while revealing new details about her own life. Mara Gay & Philip Rucker join to discuss.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Turnout among key groups for Democrats added to GOP midterm loss
articles.description: Rachel Maddow looks at turnout statistics in the 2018 midterms even as ballots are still being counted and Republicans are beginning to freak out as some Senate races are closer than they'd like.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Deadly fires ravage California communities
articles.description: Rachel Maddow reports on multiple massive, deadly wildfires sweeping through California, into residential communities, including Thousand Oaks, the scene of a deadly gun rampage just days ago.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Trump struggles to distance himself from his own acting-A.G. pick
articles.description: Rachel Maddow points out Donald Trump's "tell" of repeating himself when he's saying something that isn't true. In this case, Trump denies knowing his new acting-attorney general, Matt Whitaker, even though just a few weeks ago Trump not only said he knows Wh…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: NBC News: Trump likely faced indictment but for presidency
articles.description: Rachel Maddow shares new reporting from NBC News that when it comes to the campaign finance felonies to which Michael Cohen has already pled guilty, if it were not for Donald Trump being president, he almost certainly would have been indicted too. This is lik…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump's harshest recent attacks went to black female journalists
articles.description: After grabbing headlines for his attacks on journalists at a White House press conference, Trump went on to again criticize three female journalists who are all African-American. Mara Gay & Philip Rucker react.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: WSJ: Trump knew all about hush money to Playmate & porn star
articles.description: The Wall Street Journal is reporting that Trump played a central role paying off two women in his past leading into the presidential election. One of the reporters on the story, Rebecca Davis O'Brien, and Mimi Rocah react.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Is it already too late for Trump to stop Mueller's investigation?
articles.description: Has Robert Mueller already spread his investigation so far across the criminal justice system that Trump couldn't stop it completely if he tried? Fmr. federal prosecutor Mimi Rocah reacts.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump now: I don't know Whitaker. Trump in Oct.: I know Whitaker.
articles.description: Trump is defending naming Mueller probe critic Matthew Whitaker as acting attorney general, but has now contradicted himself on whether he knows Whitaker. Philip Rucker, Tamara Keith, and Mimi Rocah all join.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Lawrence: Trump afraid after election loss
articles.description: Trump is more afraid than ever about his future with the Russia probe after losing the midterms. His new acting A.G. is under fire his controversial comments about the probe. Lawrence discusses the constitutionality of his acting A.G.'s appointment with Laure…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Voters reject Trump in blue wave midterm results
articles.description: Six million more Americans voted for Democrats in the midterm elections than for Republicans, a sign that Trump has not gained a single voter since 2016. Now that the Democrats have won back the House, Lawrence discusses where the blue wave leads in 2020 with…

articles.title: Republicans trying to stop vote count in Florida

articles.title: Hypocrisy: Watch Lindsey Graham own himself while pandering to Trump
articles.description: Senator Lindsey Graham said there would be “holy hell to pay” if Jeff Sessions was fired. Ari Melber breaks down how Graham has reversed so many of his positions on Trump that it has descended into a “hollowing out” of Republican leadership.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Ari: How the pundits missed the blue wave in 2018
articles.description: Democrats crushed Donald Trump with a blue wave that won them more House seats than any party has won in 40 years. Despite this, many D.C. pundits and Trump allies have been downplaying the results. Ari Melber shows how when we listen to the voters, we hear t…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Denials demolished: Trump planned payoffs linked to Cohen crime
articles.description: The Wall Street Journal has published new details on Trump’s central role in payoffs to Stormy Daniels and Karen McDougal, including a personal ask to a tabloid executive. Plus, Trump is downplaying reports that he picked Acting Attorney General Matt Whitaker…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Matthews: Trump can’t threaten Obamacare with Dem House majority
articles.description: Chris says Trump has no power in the House to affect tax policy, to cut entitlements like Social Security, Medicare and Medicaid, and thanks to what Senator Mitch McConnell said yesterday, a total surrender on Obamacare.

articles.title: Dr. Sakran on gun violence: We are facing a public health crisis
articles.description: Chris says Trump has no power in the House to affect tax policy, to cut entitlements like Social Security, Medicare and Medicaid, and thanks to what Senator Mitch McConnell said yesterday, a total surrender on Obamacare.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Vox: New AG counseled Trump on investigating Clinton
articles.description: Vox is reporting that during Whitaker's time as Chief of Staff to Sessions, “he privately provided advice to the President last year on how the White House might be able to pressure the Justice Department to investigate the president's political adversaries."

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sinema lead expands to 22k in Arizona Senate race
articles.description: In the Arizona Senate race, Kyrsten Sinema's lead expands from 10,000 to 22,000. As Steve Kornacki notes, there are still 375k votes yet to be counted.
